summary: This bill, the Global Fragility Reauthorization Act, reauthorizes and amends the Global Fragility Act of 2019. It focuses on stabilizing conflict-affected areas and preventing violence globally. Key provisions include reauthorizing the Prevention and Stabilization Fund and the Complex Crises Fund, outlining new procedures for selecting priority countries, requiring annual meetings of a Global Fragility Act Steering Committee, and mandating interagency coordination for implementation. The bill also addresses staffing and resource allocation, aiming to improve the effectiveness of US foreign assistance programs in achieving national security goals.
